It basically works like this.  If a good guy gets beat
up they think the fans want to see an emotional death,
but if the bad guy gets beat up (Waspinator espically)
they think the fans expect him back next week.

--- Jonathan <jhogan@...> wrote:
> > OOC: Do you nead the head or the body to revive
> someone?
> >
> 
> OOC:
> BW was a little fuzzy on this, sometimes you knock
> the head off the whole
> bot shut down. Other times the head would still be
> functioning (in one case
> waspinators body got trash compacted and another
> TOTALLY dis-assembled) and
> be able to direct parts of the body to do whatever
> (ie waspinators head
> crawling around by being attached to the wrist of a
> hand)
> 
> Basically even without a head Inferno/warhead aren't
> going to die, dunno
> where you guys got this silly notion stasis lock =
> death for bots. Remember
> on the show Black arachnia went into extreme stasis
> lock and shut
> down....they tossed her in the CR chamber and she
> woke up (it was the big
> romeo/juliet speech episode done by silverbolt).
> However again the degree of
> damage a bot can take before they die varied.
> WAspinator could be utterly
> torn apart yet drag himself around to a CR
> chamber...dinobot gets beat on
> for a day and literally dies.
> 
> 
> 
>
